title: What religion was followed in China before Buddhism? - Quora

response.answer_text: Two religions existed in China before Buddhism arrived around 2,000 years ago. Both date from about 2,500 years ago in their current form and have older roots. One is Taoism, with the earliest written source being the Tao Te Ching. The other is Confucianism, founded by Confucius and presented in his writings, called the Analects. Though the two are often contrasted, Taoism and Confucianism have a lot in common, as well. Taoism was widely respected as a source of wisdom, and also gave rise to the folk religion, which is called folk Taoism, and is full of superstitious and magical ideas. Confucianism was the basis of Chinese government for well over 1,000 years,and passing Confucian exams was the path to government work and success in many dynasties. A note on Jean’s answer. The term Shang Di refers to the idea of a single, top, or primordial god. However, in China, this figure was never worshipped in a way parallel to the Abrahamic faiths of Judiasm, Christianity, or Islam nor is there any historical association with the Biblical God.
